articles.title: Airlines facing chronic pilot shortage of 6,000 a year, warns Boeing - live updates - The Telegraph
articles.description: European airlines need to hire more than 6,000 new pilots a year to meet an industry shortfall, Boeing has warned.

articles.author: Natasha Bertrand, CNN
articles.title: US officials say 'biggest fear' has come true as Russia cuts gas supplies to Europe - CNN
articles.description: The Biden administration is working furiously behind the scenes to keep European allies united against Russia as Moscow further cuts its energy supplies to the European Union, prompting panic on both sides of the Atlantic over potentially severe gas shortages…

articles.author: Michael Safi, Alex Lawson, Daniel Boffey, Natalie Ktena, Axel Kacoutié, Phil Maynard, Elizabeth Cassin
articles.title: What happens if Russia turns off Europe's gas? - podcast - The Guardian
articles.description: Russia is threatening to cut off its gas supply to Europe, which would force up prices and choke the continent’s economy. But could it backfire on Vladimir Putin? Dan Boffey and Alex Lawson report
articles.content: A third of all the gas used in Europe comes from Russia. Its used to heat homes and to power factories across the continent. And its running low. Russia has already cut its supply to those who are un… [+957 chars]

articles.author: Jamie McCarron
articles.title: Ireland will be exempt from EU's 15% reduction in gas - TheJournal.ie
articles.description: The measure will aim to decrease European reliance on Russian gas.
articles.content:
THE DEPARTMENT OF the Environment has said that Ireland will not be affected by a European Commission measure to reduce gas use because our gas grid is not connected to any other Member State.

articles.title: Russia's Gazprom further cuts gas flow to Europe by half amid turbine dispute - CBC News
articles.description: Russia tightened its gas squeeze on Europe on Monday as Gazprom, Russia's state-owned energy corporation, said supplies through the Nord Stream 1 pipeline to Germany would drop to just 20 per cent of capacity.
